intro: Appendicula elongata, commonly known as the elongated appendicula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, leafy stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a delicate, feathery appearance. Appendicula elongata is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
